page.title: 19CHILD'S VIEW OF THORPE END
page.content: As{children}living in Thorpe End we think it is pretty boring, there are not many activities in our village. At the moment the builders are going to make a{recreation ground}with a football pitch and tennis courts, but that could take another couple of years. The only place we have to play is on the green but that is mainly private property. The only{shops}in our village are the post office, hair dressers and garage. There is a church hall and a bus shelter. Thorpe End won the best kept village contest in 1978. Thorpe End is just outside the city of {Norwich,}it is situated in the country and is quiet and quaint. The houses are old and most of them have thatched roofs.Now the builders are making modernised houses, which most people don't think are as nice.
